column2: MEM, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After 3rd and last cycle I experienced loss of balance.  Following a neuro investigation 2 years after the administration of the drug I was found to have damage of the balance centre in the brain linked to this drug.  I have seen the results of a small study showing womenn over 60 treated with this drug for breast cancer are more likely to be affected by damage to the balance centre.

column1: Tumor of Soft/Connective Tissue that is Usually Malignant
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Just finished my treatment praying it works a hard drug had nausea and had to sleep for days after 10 days things were better Unknown if it worked

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had Emend so I did not get nausea.  Neulasta brought my WBC count to normal. I did have anemia through the 4 cycles I was given ( along with Cytoxan) 3 months after treatment ended I developed congestive heart failure luckily a mild case but still it was CHF. I am now on daily meds for CHF

column2: Spark, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had no problems with this at all.  They normally follow it the next day with a Neulasta shot, and THAT made me sick until I learned that if you take an antihistamine like Claratin one hour before the shot, you won't get sick.  Ask your doctor about this.  It really works.

column2: bobbie111a, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: 2009 six treatment three week apart I was able to work, however the day after I was weaks but was able to work. I lost my appetite,hair loss, no nause memory lapse at time, low wbc,rbc and hgb how by the time the next treatment is due it was backup. [ adraimycin and cytoxan]

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had six courses along w/ cytoxin and emeds in 1998, followed by radiation. I'm cancer free and have not had any other health issues.

column2: Broken Hearted, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was very ill during my treatments, vomiting, joint pain,low counts for many blood work up's, sore's in my mouth,hard to eatand have heart issues after only 1 year from treatment. My breast cancer came back almost 2 yrs on the date I was originally diagnosed.Now the breast cancer is in my spine and many other bones.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I guess the best thing is that I am in remission. Probably due to this and the combination of drugs. Not sure if heart symptoms I experience are from this or not.  Since chemotherapy 3 years ago I have not been able to exercise aerobically much beyond walking or I feel like I can't get adequate blood flow and breath well enough, like I'm going to faint. My heart beats very rapidly with minimal exertion. Wondering if it's because it was effected by this drug.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I rec'd 3 courses of Adriamycin & Cytoxan in 1996.  Have remained CA free.  However, am now developing numbness and some pain in toes.  Primary Care Phy. believes it is a side effect from the above.  Have not been able to locate any info.information provided to me regarding this as a side effect.

column2: 3xcancer, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This drug got the job done, but caused me to have Congestive Heart failure, 2 leaking valves on my heart, low lung function,Cardiomyopathy, and Cardiac Arrhythmia.  I had 4 rounds on 2 different occasions.  I am a 3X breast cancer survivor. It also made me very sick. But I am cancer FREE.  THANK GOD!!!!

column2: Nan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was 50 yrs old when treated, 4 years  later the memory loss, concentration & organization have not fully returned. This has made returning to the work place difficult.

column2: thunder, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I received this drug 15 yrs. ago for breast cancer. I now have congestive heart failure + have to take medication daily. I also have developed another primary site of lung cancer.

column2: survivor 2009, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I did not have a lot of side effects to this drug it was everything else you take that you get sick from.  I did not have any vomitting at all while on this.

column2: Kay, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I experienced nausea from day 1 until 5 days before my next treatment.  My treatments lasted 5-6 hours each time.  I was totally exhausted.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After my first treatment,  I didnt have any other side effects.  I am worried about the long term issues like congestive heart failure which can occur anytime between now and 30 years from now by taking this medicine!

column2: tweety200930, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i had no side effects from this drug.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
Atlanta GA, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: No worse than I expected - I had Adriamycin w/Cytoxan every 2 weeks for 4 cycles. Had great anti-nausea meds (Emend) and made it through working full time. It leaves you feeling pretty bad on day 4-5 for a couple of days but it beats the alternative (metastasis) of having a very aggressive breast cancer. Not easy - but doable!

column2: LawProf, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
